programme.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
programme.desc: A Missouri farmer joins a Confederate guerrilla unit and winds up on the run from the Union soldiers who murdered his family.

programme.title: Invitation to a Gunfighter
programme.desc: A town boss hires a gunslinger (Yul Brynner) to kill an outcast (George Segal), then hires the outcast to kill the gunslinger.

programme.title: The Cheyenne Social Club
programme.desc: Two cowboys (James Stewart, Henry Fonda) ride from Texas to Wyoming to claim an inheritance which turns out to be a brothel.

programme.desc: A wagon master is confronted by a man he wounded years before in episodes from "The Travels of Jaimie McPheeters.".

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco is accused of murdering a surveyor planning a dam.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A gunslinger's son is framed for the murder of a mayor.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A former juggler is suspected of an express robbery.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A murderer must destroy the photograph of his crime.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Infamous outlaw Augustine Chacon murders two Texas Rangers, prompting Matt and Margaret to travel south of the border to bring him to justice.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret follow the trail of Cherokee Bill after he kills a marshal riding a train and they find the outlaw hiding out in his mother's cabin.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Cattle rustling leads to the cancellation of a contract to supply beef for railroad construction crews, and Matt Clark is called in to stop it.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Two criminals vow to fight the railroad when their homestead is threatened.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Rube Burrows becomes infamous through the south for train robbery but his girlfriend is portrayed as the brains; Margaret ingratiates herself with the outlaws leading to a deadly showdown.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A former deputy and his gang terrorize a town with the help of a corrupt sheriff.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret investigate the kidnapping of banker Penrose from a stagecoach; they immediately suspect noted bandit Milt Sharp who recently escaped from a Nevada prison and his partner Dutch; a showdown takes place at the Penrose home.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret investigate when a railroad payroll worth $25,000 is stolen.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret head to Denver in the late 1860's after the killing of a railroad telegraph operator; bail jumper L H Musgrove, a known horse thief is their chief suspect; Musgrove and his pal end up facing vigilante justice.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt teams with Pat Garrett after a large herd of horses is stolen.

programme.title: Arizona Bushwhackers
programme.desc: The Union army sends a Confederate prisoner (Howard Keel) to Arizona as a lawman, but he doubles as a spy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A Southern belle arrives in North Fork claiming that Micah is her husband.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas regrets his attitude toward a reformed outlaw.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy and Charlie LeBow stage a fake duel to draw out a man that appears to be after LeBow.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: An immigrant tailor endures cruel jokes and malicious pranks.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: A notorious gunman, fresh out of prison, is framed for a bank robbery.

programme.desc: Story of a Mexican bandit's love.

programme.desc: An anthology series based on the novels of Zane Grey.

programme.desc: A cowboy learns that a man has murdered his friend and confiscated the victim's ranch.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, he stays on to help and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.
